snippet: Secret documents showed that the National Security Agency was reprimanded for violating its own rules and misleading the nation’s intelligence court about how it used data.
abstract: Intelligence officials release secret documents showing that National Security Agency was reprimanded in 2009 for violating its own procedures and misleading nation's intelligence court about how it used telephone call logs it gathers in hunt for terrorists.
lead_paragraph: Secret documents showed that the National Security Agency was reprimanded for violating its own rules and misleading the nation’s intelligence court about how it used data.

headline.main: Court Upbraided N.S.A. on Its Use of Call-Log Data
headline.print_headline: N.S.A. Violated Rules on Use of Phone Logs, Intelligence Court Found in 2009

keywords.value: National Institute of Standards and Technology
keywords.name: organizations
